utils module¶

Module providing utility functions for handling trailers, downloading from YouTube, and post-processing with FFMPEG.

This module includes classes and functions for interacting with TMDB API, downloading trailers, and performing post-processing using FFMPEG.

Classes:

  • Utils: Contains utility methods for trailer handling, downloading, and processing.

Functions:

  • replace_slash_backslash: Replaces forward slashes and backward slashes with spaces.

  • get_title: Retrieves the title of an item from its metadata.

  • trailer_pull: Retrieves trailer information from TMDB API.

  • post_process: Performs post-processing on downloaded trailers using FFMPEG.

  • download_trailers: Downloads trailers from YouTube using YoutubeDL.

  • check_space: Checks available disk space for downloading and processing trailers.

  • get_new_trailers: Retrieves trailer names that do not already exist in the specified folder.

Example of usage:

# Importing Logger class and Utils module from modules.logger import Logger from modules.utils import Utils

# Initializing the logger logger = Logger() config = {

“RADARR_USE_NAME”: “originalTitle”, “TMDB_API_KEY”: “your_tmdb_api_key_here”, # Other configurations here…

}

# Initializing an instance of Utils utils = Utils(logger, config)

# Example usage to download trailers tmdb_id = “12345” item_type = “movie”

# Fetching trailer information from TMDB trailers = utils.trailer_pull(tmdb_id, item_type)

# Downloading trailers from YouTube item_metadata = {

“title”: “Your Movie Title”, “year”: 2024, “path”: “/path/to/movie”, “outputs_folder”: “/path/to/output/folder”, # Other metadata here…

} utils.download_trailers(trailers, item_metadata)

# Checking available disk space before download download_path = “/path/to/download/trailers” has_enough_space = utils.check_space(download_path)

if not has_enough_space:

print(“Insufficient disk space. Unable to download trailers.”)

# Example usage to perform post-processing on downloaded trailers cache_path = “/path/to/cache/trailers” downloaded_files = [“trailer1.mp4”, “trailer2.mp4”, “trailer3.mp4”] utils.post_process(cache_path, downloaded_files, item_metadata)

class modules.utils.Utils(logger: Logger, config: Dict[str, str | int | bool])[source]¶

Bases: object

check_space(path: str) → bool[source]¶

Check available disk space to ensure there is enough space to download and process trailers.

Parameters:

path – Path where trailers will be downloaded

Returns:

Boolean indicating if there is enough space

download_trailers(links: List[str], item: Dict[str, str]) → None[source]¶

Download trailers from YouTube using YoutubeDL.

Parameters:

  • links – List of YouTube trailer links

  • item – Metadata of the item (movie or TV show)

Get trailer names that do not already exist in the specified folder.

Parameters:

  • trailer_names – List of trailer names to check

  • existing_files – Files existing

Returns:

List of trailer names that do not already exist in the folder

Get the title of an item from its metadata.

Parameters:

item – Metadata dictionary of the item

Returns:

Title of the item

post_process(cache_path: str, files: List[str], item: Dict[str, str]) → None[source]¶

Perform post-processing on downloaded trailers using FFMPEG.

Parameters:

  • cache_path – Path to the cache directory containing trailers

  • files – List of downloaded trailer filenames

  • item – Metadata of the item (movie or TV show)

replace_slash_backslash(text: str) → str[source]¶

Replace forward slashes and backward slashes with spaces. Replace multiple spaces with a single space.

Parameters:

text – Input text containing slashes

Returns:

Text with replaced slashes and spaces

trailer_pull(tmdb_id: str, item_type: str, seasonNumber=None) → List[Dict[str, str | bool | datetime]][source]¶

Retrieve trailer information from TMDB API.

Parameters:

  • tmdb_id – TMDB ID of the movie or TV show

  • item_type – Type of item (‘movie’ or ‘tv’)

  • parent_mode – Flag for parent mode retrieval (TV)

Returns:

List of cleaned trailer information
